tit.e: Warikanoko (a kind of traditional hair styles of females which were popular in the Edo period)
tit.cmt: 用語登録の訳に修正しました
tit.e: Warikanoko (a kind of traditional hair styles of females which were popular in the Edo period)

sen.j: 割り鹿の子（わりかのこ）とは江戸時代後期に広く十代後半から二十代前半の女性に結われた髪型。
sen.e: Warikanoko was a hairstyle widely worn by women from their late teens to early twenties in the late Edo period.

sen.j: 丸髷を二つに割って布を見せる要領で結うこともあって豪商夫人が結う場合が多かった他、待合茶屋などの飲食店で働く未婚女性が結う場合もある。
sen.e: This hairstyle, in which the chignon was two-sectioned and elaborately tied with a cloth, was commonly worn by wives of wealthy merchants and sometimes by unmarried women working at places to eat and drink such as Machiai-jaya (an assignation house).

This hairstyle, in which the chignon of Marumage (rounded hair style of a married woman) was split in two and tied showing a decorative cloth, was commonly worn by wives of wealthy merchants and sometimes by unmarried women working at restaurants such as Machiai-jaya (tea house to lend seats and tables, or rooms).
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました用語登録の訳に修正しました
sen.e: This hairstyle, in which the chignon of Marumage (rounded hair style of a married woman) was split in two and tied showing a decorative cloth, was commonly worn by wives of wealthy merchants and sometimes by unmarried women working at restaurants such as Machiai-jaya (tea house to lend seats and tables, or rooms).

sen.j: 銀杏返し（蝶々髷）を逆にしたような結い方をして、笄の下に通して髷にかけた鹿の子が可憐な印象。
sen.e: It was somewhat a reversed version of Ichogaeshi (butterfly style) hairstyle, and the dapple-dyed cloth, which bound up the chignon through the ornamental hairpin, gave a sweet impression.

It was somewhat a reversed version of Ichogaeshi (butterfly style) hairstyle, and the decorative kanoko cloth (tie-dyed cloth with a pattern of minute rings), which bound up the chignon through a kogai (hair combing up spatula), gave a sweet impression.
sen.cmt: 単語の訳を修正しました
sen.e: It was somewhat a reversed version of Ichogaeshi (butterfly style) hairstyle, and the decorative kanoko cloth (tie-dyed cloth with a pattern of minute rings), which bound up the chignon through a kogai (hair combing up spatula), gave a sweet impression.

sen.j: 一束にした髪の根元に笄を挿してから髪の束の途中を元結でくくって二つに分け、毛束の裏表をひっくり返すようにして笄に掛ける。
sen.e: Tie up the hair into a knot, pin an ornamental hairpin into the roots of the knot, tie the middle of the bundle with a paper cord to divide it into two, and attach them to the ornamental hairpin, turning the bundle inside out.

Tie the hair into a ponytail, stick a kogai into the roots of the knot, tie the middle of the ponytail with a paper cord and divide it into two, and put them on both ends of kogai, turning the hair bundles inside out.
sen.cmt: 単語の訳を修正しました動詞を変更して訳を修正しました
sen.e: Tie the hair into a ponytail, stick a kogai into the roots of the knot, tie the middle of the ponytail with a paper cord and divide it into two, and put them on both ends of kogai, turning the hair bundles inside out.

sen.j: それから元結でくくった部分より先の髪をやはり二つに分けて、輪を作った後に根元に交差して巻きつける（稚児髷を後に作る要領）。
sen.e: Then, divide the end of the part tied with a paper cord into two, make loops, and twist them around the roots of the hair to cross each other (similar to the way of making Chigomage [a form of hair formerly worn by children] at the back of the head).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, also divide the end of the part tied with a paper cord into two, make loops, and twist them around the roots of the hair crossing each other (just like making Chigomage [hairstyle for kids] on the back of the head).
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました用語登録の訳に修正しました
sen.e: Then, also divide the end of the part tied with a paper cord into two, make loops, and twist them around the roots of the hair crossing each other (just like making Chigomage [hairstyle for kids] on the back of the head).

sen.j: 笄の下に通すようにして手絡をかけて完成。
sen.e: Finish it by putting a decorative piece of silk through the ornamental hairpin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Finish it by putting a tegara, decorative cloth, through the kogai.
